Reviews.Title: “Clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: tsokie
Reviews.Content: I'm not a person that needs to invest a large portion of my vacation money in accomodations. I need a clean room with a good bed, decent breakfast and I am happy. This is exactly what we got. No extras, no frills. If this is what you are looking for then I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's Fine”
Reviews.Author: ProgressiveHobo
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Branson for a one night stay to pick-up family at the airport. Stayed at the Red Roof Inn the first time by myself and was looking for a bargain price. I was surprised to find the room was very clean and the staff were great to do business with. I've been back for several more visits. My daughter and I will continue to use the Red Roof Inn in Branson. Price was great, beds were soft, room was clean, and staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “our vacation/anniversary”
Reviews.Author: paula b
Reviews.Content: The room was clean but we confrimed a king size bed an got a queen size,the breakfast was just cereal juice milk an coffee not what the web says . The internet sucked . We will not stay here again when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Danica H
Reviews.Content: It's affordable , clean , there's a pool not that far off the strip over all good!

Reviews.Title: “Economical and Exceptionla”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: First time we have stayed at Red Roof Inn. I cannot say it is a 5 star motel but it was very clean and the staff acted in a professional way. I don't know why others only give this motel a 2 or 3 star. Folks this is not the Marriott. Don't expect steak when you are paying for bologna.

Reviews.Title: “my stay”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: my stay at the red roof inn in branson was ok.. my bed was hard as a rock and my room kinda smelled funny but other than that the stay was good.. had a good clean facility, kind room service, nice front desk and the pool was clean the first night we got there then there was some people that partied there and they put trash in the pool had the pool a total mess.. they also had a nice warm breakfast to eat!!!

Reviews.Title: “No surprise”
Reviews.Author: keyman11
Reviews.Content: Clean room, comfortable beds, no frills. Ambivalent employees, just what you would expect for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing worked.”
Reviews.Author: reemoo
Reviews.Content: The heater in the room didn't work, we had to be moved to another room. I never heard an apology. The TV remote didn't work. The hotel phone didn't work properly. The lobby breakfast was a joke; cereal and donuts. Carpet on the room floor felt NASTY. Will NOT stay in a Red Roof again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Krdrury
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Economy priced. Room clean. Bed okay. No extras, but at this price didn't expect them. Wireless Internet free which is wonderful perk for cost of room. Only suggestion to management: fix ice machine in first building. Walking across parking lot to back building would have been difficult for my husband due to knee injury if he was traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some help”
Reviews.Author: CooperCindy
Reviews.Content: The price was right, location good but clean not quite. There were cobwebs in the room, bed was hard very hard! We spent 1 night, then went elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good”
Reviews.Author: alex197630
Reviews.Content: staff was pleasant and helpful. the rooms had actual keys not cards and opening the room was somewhat trickey. the room was clean and the inn was quiet. we like red roof inn because the accept pets w/o extra charge. the ice machine by room was broken but at least it had directions to a working one. continental breakfast had your typical cereal, fruit, donuts plus waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special but it was Clean”
Reviews.Author: Geoark1946
Reviews.Content: This was one of our stops on a weeks journey nad it was welcome. The room was quite and clean the water was hot what else can you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel,, very clean-we loved it -accept pets”
Reviews.Author: scotty085
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here and it is being remodeled. The rooms are very nice & clean, I felt really comfortable , I chose this hotel because we always take our little dog along with us and it is very difficult to find a hotel that accepts pets (let along no charge!). Pool was nice and clean, easily walk to craft mall. I would definitely recommend staying here, especially the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “What a joke!”
Reviews.Author: jtj1990
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay as our rooms weren't available after the reservations were made months ahead of time. Tried to put us in the pet friendly rooms but due to allergies, we could not accept these. Then we were given other rooms in the non-pet building only to find they were already occupied. Sorry to the older gentleman who was taking an afternoon nap when we walked in on him. The staff was VERY unfriendly when dealing with our non-pet request which was made months earlier. No other rooms left, so we did too! Oh, and how many hotels still use an actual key to check in? Anyone with a copy of that key can just walk right in as we did to the poor napping soul in what was believed to be our room!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quit”
Reviews.Author: cmacar
Reviews.Content: This place is somewhat dated. But, Don't really care much. My grandma's house was dated my entire life. But, it was the most clean and comfy place on earth. So, with that being said. The main thing that matters to me in any stay is if the room is clean. The bathroom is a must! And it was. Our housekeeper was Sandy. She obviously cared and took pride in her job. Our room was very clean. The sheets and bedding were nice and clean. The other plus was the breakfast in the A.M. It was great. The trick to getting the full breakfast is to get there when it is first offered. The old saying is true." You snooze you lose" . And now for this places down falls. The pool could have used a good cleaning and the elevator should most definetly get some attention. It made some weird noises. Iike it might break down or something. I ended up using the stairs. And no, we are not heavy set people. In conclusion yes, I would stay at this red roof again. Especially for the price. It was a steal with my triple A discount and a discount code I found online. I think it was SFA? Not quite sure.

Reviews.Title: “Never will we stay here again!!!!!Disgusting :(”
Reviews.Author: mglennKeota_Oklahoma
Reviews.Content: This is the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel. The room smelled like pet urine, mold, and lemon scent to try to cover it up I guess. They said they had just cleaned the carpet and that was the smell. My son was lying on the bed and said Mom come here and smell this bedspread and it smelled just like pet urine. We woke up the next morning with flea bites all over us. This is the most disgusting place I have ever stayed and will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Floors need help!!”
Reviews.Author: Woody81
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed here one night and while the front desk staff was very helpful and pleasant, the carpet in our room caused my wife's feet to turn BLACK within just an hour or so of walking on it (see picture of socks from earlier review - EXACTLY like her results!!) Great location and free wifi was nice, but just very hard to overcome cleanliness issue like that....

Reviews.Title: “MOTEL HELL!!!”
Reviews.Author: irishqpdoll
Reviews.Content: I don't no where to start, checked in everything ok, went to the room and the door was open(should of been my first clue) when I opened the door the whole room was trashed, I'm talking about trash all over the room beds weren't made, it looked like there had just been a party there.We were moved to another room that wasn't much better, the beds were made and that was it, trash in the cans no towels or soap no supplies!!!!!! Then they were gonna move us to the3rd room, at that point enough was enough. We stayed in the 2nd room after they brought us supplies. The next morning we couldn't check out fast enough!!!!! The kicker was they allow animals there and when my grandson woke up he had flea bites all over his legs!!!!!! Flea bitten motel!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Some Improvements”
Reviews.Author: bbh907
Reviews.Content: This particular Red Roof Inn needs a few improvements.1) they need to either rehang or replace their drapes and traverse rods,the ones in our room didn't hang or close right,I needed to take a hair clip to hold them together and there were big gaps at the top so light still came in.2) they need to replace their tvs.We've stayed at this particular property before and had the same problem with the picture not coming in clear and the volume was hard to adjust,also,we didn't get half the channels they advertise because they said there was a problem with the satellite provider.3) we had chunks of black stuff blowing out of the heater,I read another review that said the same thing. The location of this particular Red Roof is great,off the beaten path,but it needs some improvements and basic maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my, WELCOME TO BRANSON!!!”
Reviews.Author: JustaGuyArizona
Reviews.Content: The drive down the 65 from the 44 was one of the most intriguing drives ever. If you haven't done it, you have to and then will understand what I mean by intriguing. My wife and I were traveling across country and one of our stops was the red roof inn in Branson. I have nothing bad to say about the motel itself. It had an older motel feeling to it, but for the price, what can you expect. The staff was friendly, the room was clean and comfortable, and it was off of the main drag of all the Branson activities. Our cat was welcomed at no additional cost. I will say that if you are traveling to Branson, there are a whole lot of motels and hotels close together. So do your research if you are looking for a more expensive feeling hotel or motel. However if you have pets, this is the perfect place for you. And trust me, make sure the place you stay is away from the main strip.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Floor!! You should always wear socks in a motel!!”
Reviews.Author: bonbon44
Reviews.Content: This motel is in a good location and is an OK motel. We stayed there in 2005 and liked it so I thought we would again. We won't from now on. It was not very clean, mainly the FLOOR. If I can, I am going to post a picture of my socks that I wore in the room. Just FYI... You should NEVER walk around in a motel room w/out socks or shoes. My socks are filthy! A friend told me I should have shown them to the manager. I probably should have. The floor was just nasty, nasty, nasty! The door was dirty and the surfaces like the table were sticky. Other than that, it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “clean and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: mogirl12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the location is good. We will probably stay again if we can not find another location for the same cost. The breakfast is mostly gone within and hour of opening. The only food is cereal, waffles, donuts and apples. The donuts are horrible which was only available for 2 mornings of a 4 night stay and they were horrible. The milk taste like powder skim milk. This is why I would look for another place to stay. If you do not care about breakfast this is an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “quiet location”
Reviews.Author: johnv0129
Reviews.Content: Quiet location, away from the traffic. Room was clean, breakfast better then most Red Roof Inns. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: tlsullivan215
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay because of the wonderful staff, very nice and helpful. You can't beat the breakfast, what a deal. Everything was nice and clean, but the location is perfect, for all the things to do on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay for comfort and convienence”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaHorsemaster
Reviews.Content: The ease of finding the Inn and not having to fight traffic was such a suprise. Being off the main drive makes it more convienent for getting to and from shows, eating places and other attractions for entire families. The office employees made us feel comfortable and extremely helpful in locating special tickets . The housekeeping is great. The rooms are clean and nothing was overlooked for our comfort. The corners were swept and no lint was ignored. It was nice to feel that each bed was totally clean and not just fresh sheets. As seniors we appreciate quality and service; the Red Roof Inn has both.

Reviews.Title: “Could've Been Better”
Reviews.Author: motorcity70
Reviews.Content: Red Roof in Branson did provide a clean room with the basic amenities. However not all of the standard Red Roof Inn amenities were provided. This includes a charge for a pet not disclosed on the website and no weekday newspaper. A pet charge is reasonable, but should be disclosed when the rate is provided assuming that one advises the property they are bringing a pet and the chain normally allows a single pet in a room without an additional charge. If a good rate is obtained here I suggest staying as the necessities were provided. However, I'd look at other properities in town and stay elsewhere if a comparable rate is offered. Be sure to call the property and check to see if the pool is open, particularly if you're bringing children. It wasn't opened a few days prior to Memorial Day and I'd hate to see kids disappointed if they aren't going to open the pool this year.

Reviews.Title: “not the best”
Reviews.Author: Dogtravlers
Reviews.Content: We book our room through there website for 3 nights. This motel does not have everything listed on there website. there website states wireless Internet, and 3 HBO channels. The wireless Internet is not accessible from the front building, might work in the back building but not the front, there was no HBO channels at all and the TV's were old as dirt. Our was fuzzy and the color was awful,. The parking also at this motel is a night mare if they are full. One night we had to park in the hotel parking lot next to them as there was full. The hotel next to them are out of business at this moment. ( I don't know what you would do if they had been in business). Two nights we had to park in the very back of the motel. The ice machine in the front building doesn't work. The continental breakfast is awful as well. I suggest bring your own or go to a local restaurant. The donuts tasted like play doe. The waffle's were ok but there is a long line for those. And you have to make your own. There were two kinds of cereal, milk, orange and apple juice and coffee. We didn't book this room to spend all our time in it, but thought if we had gotten to hot we could go cool off in the room for a while kick back and watch a movie, the pool looked clean, but we never used it and it closes at 10:00 PM. The house keeping at this hotel is another issue as well. One day we left at 9:30 am returned at 6:30 PM and our room had not been cleaned. I complained to the front desk and when returned at 11:30 PM it was clean, then the next day we left early return around 6:00 PM the room had been clean but they turned our air conditioner off, which didin't work all that well, it took about 2 to 3 hours to cool our room off. And of course we were there during the heat wave they had in Missouri in August temp well in 100 + range and high 80 at night. The desk clerk really didn't care about any of our complaints. I would suggest this hotel as last resort for the price, you would more then likely get better service at another hotel. This motel is easy access to the yellow route and hwy 76, It is off the main hwy so it is in a fairly quite area. I would not suggest this hotel for walking very many places, this is one where you will need your car to get around. I would also like to say this is not my first time at staying at a Red Roof Inn, prior to this motel my experience with them have always been good, the whole reason we choose this hotel. They are usually a chain that has clean rooms, and a decent price. This was just not up to par with the other motels of there I have stayed in before.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice location”
Reviews.Author: den&holly
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 2 nights - April 13 & 14, 2007. We used on online booking site for Branson and paid $40 a night. The location is good, a short way off 76 and behind the Grand Palace and Wal-Mart. Easy to get to and travel around town. There is a small craft mall and a few restaurants withing easy walking distance. The room was a typical budget room. Clean, plenty of towels, and beds a hard as those we sleep on in Mexico!! Don't get me wrong, I didn't expect pillow top mattresses - but these were really hard. There was soap and a small coffee maker (with coffee), but no hairdryer or shampoo. They do have an outdoor pool - but not open yet. Breakfast was budget also - cold cereal, sweet rolls and waffles. No fruit or yogurt offered. The coffee is a self-service machine which makes coffee, lattee, hot chocolate and is available anytime in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not very organized”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and would have loved to have stayed if not for the poor service. We had been promised a crib 1 month prior to check in. Called to confirm prior to arrival on same day. Checked in and there was not a crib in room. Was told one would be brought up. One hour later I was told they didn't have any cribs and could check out if I wished. So I did. One month later I received a bill for a three day no show. Took the manager over a month to straighten it out. I would suggest staying at the Econo Lodge next to Red Roof. Econo Lodge is willing to swing a deal if you ask. The rooms are clean and the staff is great.

HotelInfo.Name: Red Roof Inn Branson
HotelInfo.Address: 220 S. Wildwood Drive, Branson, MO 65616
